content.original: The Quicsell Company (also known as the Quicksell Company, Quicsel Company, Quiksell Company, Quickcel Company, Quiccell Company, Quiccel Company, Quikcell Company, Quikcel Company, and briefly The Qwix'ell Company, due to an incredibly complicated corporate structure that has baffled generations of tax auditors) is a military goods manufacturer with branches across the Inner Sphere. Though known throughout the Sphere, their products are notorious for being of low quality. In fact the AFFS doesn't accept Quikscell products into service until a team of technicians have inspected every vehicle. If repairs need to be made, they are made immediately and the AFFS charges the time to Quikscell.
content.prevOriginal: The Quicsell Company (also known as the Quicksell Company, Quicsel Company, Quiksell Company, Quickcel Company, Quiccell Company, Quiccel Company, Quikcell Company, Quikcel Company, and briefly The Qwix'ell Company, due to an incredibly complicated corporate structure that has baffled generations of tax auditors) is a military goods manufacturer with branches across the Inner Sphere. Though known throughout the Sphere, their products are notorious for being of low quality. In fact the AFFS doesn't accept Quikscell products into service until a team of technicians have inspected every vehicle. If repairs need to be made, they are made immediately and the AFFS charges the time to Quikscell.

Though known throughout the Sphere, their products are notorious for being of low quality. content.original: Most combat vehicles have three or more sets of wheels per side equipped with rugged run-flat pneumatic tires. Materials have improved but wheels themselves have changed little in thousands of years. There's a reason why ''reinventing the wheel'' is a saying saying to describe things that are a waste of effort. For at least 6000 years the wheel has been the first choice when humans want to make something mobile.

For at least 6000 years the wheel has been the first choice when humans want to make something mobile.

content.original: Wheeled vehicles are easy to drive, relatively quiet in operation, weight efficient and simple. On the other hand they are worse off road and in rough terrain than tracked vehicles.

content.original: Most combat vehicles have three or more sets of wheels per side equipped with rugged run-flat pneumatic tires. Materials have improved but wheels themselves have changed little in thousands of years. There's a reason why ''reinventing the wheel'' is a saying saying to describe things that are a waste of effort. For at least 6000 years the wheel has been the first choice when humans want to make something mobile.

content.original: Unlike most mechs, the majority of combat vehicles are crewed by more than one individual. Three or four has been the standard for centuries, with the primary roles being Commander, Driver, and Gunner. There may also be loaders, communications operators, engineers and additional gunners. They are generally grouped together into a single so called fighting compartment. Weapons fire that penetrates this compartment can wound or kill the entire crew.
content.prevOriginal: Unlike most mechs, the majority of combat vehicles are crewed by more than one individual. Three or four has been the standard for centuries, with the primary roles being Commander, Driver, and Gunner. There may also be loaders, communications operators, engineers and additional gunners. They are generally grouped together into a single so called fighting compartment. Weapons fire that penetrates this compartment can wound or kill the entire crew.

Three or four has been the standard for centuries, with the primary roles being Commander, Driver, and Gunner. There may also be loaders, communications operators, engineers and additional gunners. They are generally grouped together into a single so called fighting compartment. Weapons fire that penetrates this compartment can wound or kill the entire crew.

content.original: Provides a [AMT] bonus to actions that generate Resolve.
content.prevOriginal: Provides a [AMT] bonus to actions that generate Resolve.
content.content: Provides a [AMT] bonus to actions that generate Resolve.

content.original: Environmental Sealing is a series of filters, air tanks, hermetic seals, and scrubbers that allow a unit to operate in hostile environments like the vacuum of space, under water, or toxic waste dumps. All BattleMechs, AeroSpace and Conventional Fighters, DropShips, and submarine vehicles include environmental sealing as part of their construction. This sealing takes up no additional weight or space as it's built into the unit. Other units, like IndustrialMechs and combat vehicles, can be equipped with environmental sealing at a cost of 10% of the unit's weight.
content.prevOriginal: Environmental Sealing is a series of filters, air tanks, hermetic seals, and scrubbers that allow a unit to operate in hostile environments like the vacuum of space, under water, or toxic waste dumps. All BattleMechs, AeroSpace and Conventional Fighters, DropShips, and submarine vehicles include environmental sealing as part of their construction. This sealing takes up no additional weight or space as it's built into the unit. Other units, like IndustrialMechs and combat vehicles, can be equipped with environmental sealing at a cost of 10% of the unit's weight.
content.content: Environmental Sealing is a series of filters, air tanks, hermetic seals, and scrubbers that allow a unit to operate in hostile environments like the vacuum of space, under water, or toxic waste dumps. All BattleMechs, AeroSpace and Conventional Fighters, DropShips, and submarine vehicles include environmental sealing as part of their construction. This sealing takes up no additional weight or space as it's built into the unit. Other units, like IndustrialMechs and combat vehicles, can be equipped with environmental sealing at a cost of 10% of the unit's weight.

content.original: A vehicle turret is a structure that allows weapons to be aimed and elevated independently of the vehicle's facing. This gives tanks one of their few true advantages over Battlemechs: Easy 360 degree coverage with their main gun(s).
content.prevOriginal: A vehicle turret is a structure that allows weapons to be aimed and elevated independently of the vehicle's facing. This gives tanks one of their few true advantages over Battlemechs: Easy 360 degree coverage with their main gun(s).
content.content: A vehicle turret is a structure that allows weapons to be aimed and elevated independently of the vehicle's facing. This gives tanks one of their few true advantages over Battlemechs: Easy 360 degree coverage with their main gun(s).

content.original: The Vehicular Direct Neural Interface was a special type of cybernetic implant developed for the Manei Domini. The system worked in principle similar to the Clans' Enhanced Imaging system, allowing MechWarriors, aerospace fighter pilots, battle armor troopers and even combat vehicle and Small Craft crews to become one with their machines. Unlike the EI system, however, VDNI was able to ward off the short-term negative effects of the technology by employing improved circuit breakers and forcing users to regularly ingest a special chemical agent.
content.prevOriginal: The Vehicular Direct Neural Interface was a special type of cybernetic implant developed for the Manei Domini. The system worked in principle similar to the Clans' Enhanced Imaging system, allowing MechWarriors, aerospace fighter pilots, battle armor troopers and even combat vehicle and Small Craft crews to become one with their machines. Unlike the EI system, however, VDNI was able to ward off the short-term negative effects of the technology by employing improved circuit breakers and forcing users to regularly ingest a special chemical agent.
content.content: The Vehicular Direct Neural Interface was a special type of cybernetic implant developed for the Manei Domini. The system worked in principle similar to the Clans' Enhanced Imaging system, allowing MechWarriors, aerospace fighter pilots, battle armor troopers and even combat vehicle and Small Craft crews to become one with their machines. Unlike the EI system, however, VDNI was able to ward off the short-term negative effects of the technology by employing improved circuit breakers and forcing users to regularly ingest a special chemical agent.

content.original: This unit generates an extra EVASIVE charge from movement actions (up to its maximum).
content.prevOriginal: This unit generates an extra EVASIVE charge from movement actions (up to its maximum).
content.content: This unit generates an extra EVASIVE charge from movement actions (up to its maximum).

content.original: For all intents and purposes identical to a modern internal combustion engine, the I.C.E. in BattleTech is used mainly for conventional vehicles and IndustrialMechs. Its power output is less than a fusion engine of similar mass, meaning an I.C.E. needs to be heavier in order to have the same engine rating of a fusion engine.
content.prevOriginal: For all intents and purposes identical to a modern internal combustion engine, the I.C.E. in BattleTech is used mainly for conventional vehicles and IndustrialMechs. Its power output is less than a fusion engine of similar mass, meaning an I.C.E. needs to be heavier in order to have the same engine rating of a fusion engine.
content.content: For all intents and purposes identical to a modern internal combustion engine, the I.C.E. in BattleTech is used mainly for conventional vehicles and IndustrialMechs. Its power output is less than a fusion engine of similar mass, meaning an I.C.E. needs to be heavier in order to have the same engine rating of a fusion engine.

content.original: Fuel Cell engines are primarily used in civilian applications like rail systems, personal transport, and IndustrialMechs. Fuel Cell engines generate electrical power that is then used by the vehicle to operate its propulsion system. A Fuel Cell engine has several advantages over the typical Internal Combustion Engine. While they require an oxidizer to operate, they are readily able to accept a stored oxidizer along with their fuel, making it a good choice for submarines, satellites, and naval applications. As most fuel cells run on hydrogen and oxygen, they have no exhaust other than water vapor so Fuel Cells are also used as generators for buildings and other large structures. Cannot use Additional Cooling Kits, Exchanger or Banks.
content.prevOriginal: Fuel Cell engines are primarily used in civilian applications like rail systems, personal transport, and IndustrialMechs. While they require an oxidizer to operate, they are readily able to accept a stored oxidizer along with their fuel, making it a good choice for submarines, satellites, and naval applications. As most fuel cells run on hydrogen and oxygen, they have no exhaust other than water vapor so Fuel Cells are also used as generators for buildings and other large structures. Cannot use Additional Cooling Kits, Exchanger or Banks.

While they require an oxidizer to operate, they are readily able to accept a stored oxidizer along with their fuel, making it a good choice for submarines, satellites, and naval applications. content.original: This is a series of cranes and hoists that allow the lifting of units, be they mech, tank, or turret. Airlifted units can take actions while lifted but cannot move in any way while lifted.

content.original: The VTOL Jet Booster is a piece of equipment used to increase the speed of any VTOL. The Booster itself has existed in different forms since the time of Early Spaceflight. Its modern versions were separately created by Clan Hell's Horses in 2839, while Cal-Boeing of Dorwinion developed its own in 3009 in the Inner Sphere. Activatable: EXPLODES ON FAILURE!

content.original: CASE is short for Cellular Ammunition Storage Equipment. In an internal explosion event, CASE prevents the explosion from traveling to adjacent mech compartments. While CASE does not prevent damage to occur in the protected area, it does prevent it from passing through, helping to prevent ammo explosions to reach the center torso of a mech.
